sentence.text: High-throughput sequencing analysis has accelerated searches for genes associated with risk for colorectal cancer (CRC); germline mutations in base-excision repair, AP site formation, nuclear-transcribed mRNA catabolic process, nonsense-mediated decay, FANCM, nucleotide-excision repair, DNA incision, TP53, BUB1, attachment of spindle microtubules to kinetochore, neural crest formation, and protein dephosphorylation have been recently proposed to increase CRC risk.

entity.text: nuclear-transcribed mRNA catabolic process, nonsense-mediated decay
attachment of spindle microtubules to kinetochore
